snippet: Signs of stabilizing prices after a recent downturn are likely to be welcomed by the Federal Reserve, which has a 2 percent inflation target.
abstract: Labor Dept reports that Consumer Price Index increased 0.2 percent in October after two consecutive months of declines; rise is attributed to uptick in cost of health care and other services.
lead_paragraph: Signs of stabilizing prices after a recent downturn are likely to be welcomed by the Federal Reserve, which has a 2 percent inflation target.

headline.main: Consumer Prices Rose in October, Government Says
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Consumer Price Index Rose 0.2% in October
